metadata.description: Neurotransmitter-mediated modulation of reflex excitability and plasticity.
metadata.notes: Highlights neuromodulator influence on reflex loops separate from biomimetic synapse tables.

dopamine.stimulus: Salient motor learning cues or reward prediction errors.
dopamine.afferent: Mesencephalic dopaminergic neurons receiving cortical and limbic input.
dopamine.integration: Nigrostriatal projections adjusting basal ganglia output to spinal centers.
dopamine.effector: Facilitated initiation and scaling of learned reflex adaptations.

serotonin.stimulus: Raphe nucleus activation during arousal or locomotion.
serotonin.afferent: Ascending sensory and descending motor feedback to raphe nuclei.
serotonin.integration: Diffuse serotonergic projections enhancing spinal motor neuron responsiveness.
serotonin.efferent: Serotonergic release across spinal cord and brainstem.
serotonin.effector: Increased excitability of postural and locomotor reflex circuits.

gaba.stimulus: Activation of inhibitory interneurons restraining reflex output.
gaba.afferent: Interneuronal networks sensing excessive excitatory drive.
gaba.integration: GABAergic synapses dampening motor neuron firing.
gaba.effector: Suppression of reflex amplitude and prevention of oscillations.

glutamate.stimulus: Primary excitatory drive from sensory afferents and descending commands.
glutamate.afferent: Glutamatergic terminals at spinal interneurons and motor neurons.
glutamate.integration: AMPA/NMDA receptor activation amplifying reflex throughput.
glutamate.efferent: Excitatory synaptic transmission across reflex arcs.
glutamate.effector: Rapid propagation of reflex activity enabling timely responses.

acetylcholine.stimulus: Motor neuron firing and autonomic preganglionic activation.
acetylcholine.integration: Cholinergic synapses at neuromuscular junctions and autonomic ganglia.
acetylcholine.effector: Muscle contraction and ganglionic relay sustaining reflex execution.

endorphins.stimulus: Stress, sustained pain, or rhythmic exercise activating descending modulatory systems.
endorphins.afferent: Spinoreticular and limbic inputs to periaqueductal gray.
endorphins.integration: Endogenous opioid release modulating dorsal horn and brainstem nuclei.
endorphins.efferent: Opioid peptides acting on inhibitory interneurons.
endorphins.effector: Reduction of pain-mediated reflex gain and promotion of analgesic states.
